verb.description: (of a person's voice) shake or tremble in speaking, typically through nervousness or emotion.
examples: “I'm not safe here, am I?” she said in a quavering voice

noun.description: A shake or tremble in a person's voice.
examples: it was impossible to hide the slight quaver in her voice

noun.description: A note having the time value of an eighth of a whole note or half a quarter note, represented by a large dot with a hooked stem.

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb in the general sense tremble): from dialect quave quake, tremble, probably from an Old English word related to quake. The noun is first recorded (mid 16th century) as a musical term.
